posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
If it's not too much trouble, please furnish at least some type of build schedule so we can imagine what your plan is. It doesn't need to look like finished build.  An outline of some sort would suffice.

Does drow race really get a penalty to SR?  That's what it looks like and that doesn't make any sense to me.

What exactly are you trying to build, a battle cleric? That would be my guess.  If so, where is the WS/EWS from fighter levels?  Also, if a battle cleric, swap out spell pen for empowered. You'll be needing it.  Or just prune down on most of the spell-related feats altogether.  Blind fight is a must.  With Divine Power, bumping STR is a waste.  Leave it at 10 or 12 max.  DEX better at 14 (at least 13 starting) to get Dodge. Really hard to fine tune this the way it sits.  Make sure to list any ability adjustments for the subrace as well.

What domains did you select?

Your skill set seems really conflicting to me but won't make any suggestions without seeing some sort of organized level-by-level list posted.  That's just me.  Perhaps other members may like to take some shots in the dark.  You need not furnish the enhancements that items provide except the general magic level cap for armor & weapons (like +5, or whatever).  

Make sure to provide both beginning and ending ability spreads so we can identify the state of the toon at creation.

Help us help you. Please.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Getting a better picture of your situation I think.  Correct the following interpretations should any be inaccurate or not applicable:
1.  You've already leveled this toon to some level (which we members do not yet know) and are seeking a way to optimize the levels left to the 30 cap.
2.  You are trying to build more of a caster than battle cleric.  A battle cleric self-buffs and attacks using spells mostly for finishing.
3.  You've already decided on a tactic (the silence one, which isn't bad at all IMO) and would like to optimize your build to support that tactic.
4.  This is a PvP build probably geared more towards dominating arcanists than a more-diluted general one-size-fits-all dueler.
5.  Reflex saves are paramount, followed closely by Will saves (i.e. silence save).

At this moment, without further clarification, these seem the most defined characteristics of your current situation.

As mentioned previously, STR bumps are wasted unless they nerfed DP on Aretlith but don't see it on the list (assuming the wiki info is current but who knows).  But apparently this is water over the dam anyway.  Don't see DM/DS being a factor with a spell-intensive build so STR could be quite low.  Anyhoo..

Yes.  Unless you find some permahaste (probably none available on Arelith, though), you''ll need to stock up on Potions of Speed because if you want to rush an arcanist, THEY will be hasted... ALWAYS.  Trying to stay hasted during prolonged PvP sessions relying solely on potion buffs can be a real bite.  Lots of lost rounds and AoOs.

The best fit would have been (in retrospect, of course), to focus more on DEX since your melee attack will be ancillary anyway.  KD/IKD is fine, but with a high-level acid sheath you could end up pounding yourself to death with a weapon anyway, especially if they polymorph into a balor or other uber HP form and send the mummy lord or dracolich to defend them (assuming they took those epic spells) while they wait for one of their Bigby's to stick..  There's nothing stopping them from using extended greater sanctuary and casting a BBoD either.  And they all keep True Seeing intact so stealth (and invisibility for that matter) is worthless.

Caster-focused attack schemes should really concentrate on building as many caster levels as possible, hoping that their spells can pass SR checks regularly and just use their divine powers alone to dominate melee situations (divine damage is usually impossible to resist or reduce, hence the effectiveness of Divine Might if you have it).

I'll await feedback before I comment further, Hafen.

@Valerfor: Thanks for the clarification.  Actually, I figured it was a typo but now that you've made the error more visible, EVERY viewer/contributor will understand.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: If Divine power still gives the extra attack, keep BAB at 15 at level 20 so you have 3 natural attacks and can benefit from the extra AB you get with the 4th attack from DP. With the Cl 12/ F 5/ Ro 3 split at level 20 you get BAB 16 and get the cleric spellpower late. Take cl 20 pre epic, then 4 Fighter levels and grab EWF and a general feat (eg G. str/G. wis)at level 21, AS at level 22, then WS and EWS at level 24. Then take 3 levels of Rogue and max tumble at level 27. Top it off with two Fighter levels, max discipline and take EP as bonus Fighter feat. The last level is Cleric and let you max spellcraft. Final spreadL Cl 21/ F6/ Ro3. That way you only spend one general epic feat on combat feats and the xp penalties will also come later.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Hafen wrote:
--clip--
I wont have enough spells to allow myself luxury of divine power as main spells. But what i will use to the fully is divine favor +5 ab and divine dmg.


 
You're not serious, are you?

A battle cleric without Divine Power? It is gimped right off the bat.  

If you planned your slot allotment this poorly perhaps you should have made the Strength domain a priority from jump street.  But since you didn't, are you telling us you don't have room to slot a single extended DP at level 5?  Or a few at Level 4?  That's really all it takes.  Strength domain would have allowed Levels 3 and 4 to manage them as well.  This is a common domain choice for battle clerics for exactly the reasons described.  I'm having trouble imagining what "main spells" are being used at Level 4 and 5 for a build that is claiming not to be focusing on offensive spellcasting.  It's possible if there are limitations for domain choices for drow that it may not be the best choice, if that is a customization granted on the server.

You would have been better assigning all but STR 13 to WIS if you were anticipating some difficulty managing slots.  I love PA/IPA for a battle cleric with almost infinite AB buffing capacity but STR focus (anything over the prereq is "focus") is counter-productive to say the least.

I'll see what I can piece together for a drow priestess from clvl 13 to 30 but it won't be pretty. This is not going to rounding off, though.  More like trying to get a car wreck back on the road again long enough to make it to a service station.  I'll probably be ticketed for working on it in a No Parking zone.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Cleric 23/ Rogue 3/ Fighter 4, is also a good choice to get close to undispellable while keeping the number of feats the same. Keep Strength to 13, DP will raise that to 18 and then an empowered bull's strength will make you a powerhouse. DP is vital, you will want at least 2 extended and 2 normal versions of it, same thing with DF as well. One of your domains should give you haste and the other improved invisibility, those are absolutely the best buffs you can have.
